page.title: 04River Nent (2) Alston Moor
page.content: Many different kinds of{wild flowers, {grasses}and{trees}grow along the banks of the{River Nent}and many{insects}and {butterflies}can be seen there. In July {Oyster Catchers}nest between Blaygill Bridge and Foreshield. In this region the river changes its character as it{meanders}through a wide{flood {plain}forming banks of coarse sand and shingle. At several points along the river the recently capped{ventilation {shafts}from the{Nent Force Level}can be seen. This tunnel, now sealed, runs for over four miles under the river. Begun in l776 and finished in l842, it was built to drain the lead mines further up the valley and take out the lead and waste products. Some hope that it will one day be re-opened as a tourist attraction. Paths have recently been improved by the Manpower Services to encourage tourists.
